Answer: A: Because the membrane selectively permits cargo in and out, which the speaker likens to control officers, and the slide bullets explicitly note a “selective barrier” and “transport of nutrients and waste.”

The presenter compares the plasma membrane to airport passport control because it acts as a selective barrier, allowing certain substances to pass through while blocking others. This is supported by the slide bullets that mention a "selective barrier" and the transport of nutrients and waste. The slide also shows a diagram of the membrane with different types of molecules passing through it, further emphasizing the selective nature of the membrane.
